intro: Manulea hispida, commonly known as the rough manulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
